channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Mining Gaze for Contrastive Learning toward Computer-Assisted Diagnosis
item.description: Accordingly, we introduce the Medical contrastive Gaze Image Pre-training (McGIP) as a plug-and-play module for contrastive learning frameworks.

item.title: ControlNet-XS: Designing an Efficient and Effective Architecture for Controlling Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: For this, a recent and highly popular approach is to use a controlling network, such as ControlNet, in combination with a pre-trained image generation model, such as Stable Diffusion.

item.title: Learning Naturally Aggregated Appearance for Efficient 3D Editing
item.description: Neural radiance fields, which represent a 3D scene as a color field and a density field, have demonstrated great progress in novel view synthesis yet are unfavorable for editing due to the implicitness.

item.title: Navigating Open Set Scenarios for Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: In real-world scenarios, human actions often fall outside the distribution of training data, making it crucial for models to recognize known actions and reject unknown ones.

item.title: Neural Text to Articulate Talk: Deep Text to Audiovisual Speech Synthesis achieving both Auditory and Photo-realism
item.description: Our method, which we call NEUral Text to ARticulate Talk (NEUTART), is a talking face generator that uses a joint audiovisual feature space, as well as speech-informed 3D facial reconstructions and a lip-reading loss for visual supervision.

item.title: Concrete Subspace Learning based Interference Elimination for Multi-task Model Fusion
item.description: At the upper level, we focus on learning a shared Concrete mask to identify the subspace, while at the inner level, model merging is performed to maximize the performance of the merged model.

item.title: U-MixFormer: UNet-like Transformer with Mix-Attention for Efficient Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation has witnessed remarkable advancements with the adaptation of the Transformer architecture.

item.title: STDiff: Spatio-temporal Diffusion for Continuous Stochastic Video Prediction
item.description: Predicting future frames of a video is challenging because it is difficult to learn the uncertainty of the underlying factors influencing their contents.

item.title: Sherpa3D: Boosting High-Fidelity Text-to-3D Generation via Coarse 3D Prior
item.description: Instead of retraining a costly viewpoint-aware model, we study how to fully exploit easily accessible coarse 3D knowledge to enhance the prompts and guide 2D lifting optimization for refinement.

item.title: IEKG: A Commonsense Knowledge Graph for Idiomatic Expressions
item.description: Unlike prior works that enable IE comprehension through fine-tuning PTLMs with sentences containing IEs, in this work, we construct IEKG, a commonsense knowledge graph for figurative interpretations of IEs.

item.title: M3SOT: Multi-frame, Multi-field, Multi-space 3D Single Object Tracking
item.description: 3D Single Object Tracking (SOT) stands a forefront task of computer vision, proving essential for applications like autonomous driving.

item.title: On Meta-Prompting
item.description: We call these approaches meta-prompting, or prompting to obtain prompts.

item.title: Compound Text-Guided Prompt Tuning via Image-Adaptive Cues
item.description: We introduce text supervision to the optimization of prompts, which enables two benefits: 1) releasing the model reliance on the pre-defined category names during inference, thereby enabling more flexible prompt generation; 2) reducing the number of inputs to the text encoder, which decreases GPU memory consumption significantly.

item.title: UIEDP:Underwater Image Enhancement with Diffusion Prior
item.description: To address this issue, we propose UIE with Diffusion Prior (UIEDP), a novel framework treating UIE as a posterior distribution sampling process of clear images conditioned on degraded underwater inputs.

item.title: Intraoperative 2D/3D Image Registration via Differentiable X-ray Rendering
item.description: Preoperatively, a CNN is trained to regress the pose of a randomly oriented synthetic X-ray rendered from the preoperative CT.

item.title: Learning Hierarchical Prompt with Structured Linguistic Knowledge for Vision-Language Models
item.description: To address this limitation and prioritize harnessing structured knowledge, this paper advocates for leveraging LLMs to build a graph for each description to model the entities and attributes describing the category, as well as their correlations.

item.title: MUST: An Effective and Scalable Framework for Multimodal Search of Target Modality
item.description: We investigate the problem of multimodal search of target modality, where the task involves enhancing a query in a specific target modality by integrating information from auxiliary modalities.

item.title: BoschAI @ Causal News Corpus 2023: Robust Cause-Effect Span Extraction using Multi-Layer Sequence Tagging and Data Augmentation
item.description: Understanding causality is a core aspect of intelligence.

item.title: DiAD: A Diffusion-based Framework for Multi-class Anomaly Detection
item.description: Reconstruction-based approaches have achieved remarkable outcomes in anomaly detection.

item.title: MATK: The Meme Analytical Tool Kit
item.description: The rise of social media platforms has brought about a new digital culture called memes.

item.title: Ternary Spike: Learning Ternary Spikes for Spiking Neural Networks
item.description: To handle the problem, we propose a ternary spike neuron to transmit information.

item.title: DiffAIL: Diffusion Adversarial Imitation Learning
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a method named diffusion adversarial imitation learning (DiffAIL), which introduces the diffusion model into the AIL framework.

item.title: GTA: Gated Toxicity Avoidance for LM Performance Preservation
item.description: Our findings reveal that gated toxicity avoidance efficiently achieves comparable levels of toxicity reduction to the original CTG methods while preserving the generation performance of the language model.

item.title: Dense X Retrieval: What Retrieval Granularity Should We Use?
item.description: We discover that the retrieval unit choice significantly impacts the performance of both retrieval and downstream tasks.

item.title: ASF-YOLO: A Novel YOLO Model with Attentional Scale Sequence Fusion for Cell Instance Segmentation
item.description: We propose a novel Attentional Scale Sequence Fusion based You Only Look Once (YOLO) framework (ASF-YOLO) which combines spatial and scale features for accurate and fast cell instance segmentation.

item.title: TMT-VIS: Taxonomy-aware Multi-dataset Joint Training for Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: What we possess are numerous isolated filed-specific datasets, thus, it is appealing to jointly train models across the aggregation of datasets to enhance data volume and diversity.

item.title: Attribute Annotation and Bias Evaluation in Visual Datasets for Autonomous Driving
item.description: This paper addresses the often overlooked issue of fairness in the autonomous driving domain, particularly in vision-based perception and prediction systems, which play a pivotal role in the overall functioning of Autonomous Vehicles (AVs).

item.title: EQ-Bench: An Emotional Intelligence Benchmark for Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce EQ-Bench, a novel benchmark designed to evaluate aspects of emotional intelligence in Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Semantic Connectivity-Driven Pseudo-labeling for Cross-domain Segmentation
item.description: This approach formulates pseudo-labels at the connectivity level and thus can facilitate learning structured and low-noise semantics.

item.title: Flexible visual prompts for in-context learning in computer vision
item.description: Additionally, we propose a technique for support set selection, which involves choosing the most relevant images to include in this set.

item.title: Proxy-based Item Representation for Attribute and Context-aware Recommendation
item.description: Additionally, that the proxy embeddings are shared across all items allows the infrequent items to borrow training signals of frequent items in a unified model structure and end-to-end manner.

item.title: Textual Prompt Guided Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, an effective textual prompt guided image restoration model has been proposed.

item.title: MalPurifier: Enhancing Android Malware Detection with Adversarial Purification against Evasion Attacks
item.description: Experimental results on two Android malware datasets demonstrate that MalPurifier outperforms the state-of-the-art defenses, and it significantly strengthens the vulnerable malware detector against 37 evasion attacks, achieving accuracies over 90. 91%.

item.title: No Prior Mask: Eliminate Redundant Action for Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The large action space is one fundamental obstacle to deploying Reinforcement Learning methods in the real world.

item.title: CSOT: Curriculum and Structure-Aware Optimal Transport for Learning with Noisy Labels
item.description: However, the current approaches rely heavily on the model's predictions and evaluate each sample independently without considering either the global and local structure of the sample distribution.

item.title: SurvBeNIM: The Beran-Based Neural Importance Model for Explaining the Survival Models
item.description: A new method called the Survival Beran-based Neural Importance Model (SurvBeNIM) is proposed.

item.title: Exploiting Label Skews in Federated Learning with Model Concatenation
item.description: However, non-IID data has been a key challenge in FL, which could significantly degrade the accuracy of the final model.

item.title: BAT: Behavior-Aware Human-Like Trajectory Prediction for Autonomous Driving
item.description: The ability to accurately predict the trajectory of surrounding vehicles is a critical hurdle to overcome on the journey to fully autonomous vehicles.

item.title: Multi-class Support Vector Machine with Maximizing Minimum Margin
item.description: Support Vector Machine (SVM) stands out as a prominent machine learning technique widely applied in practical pattern recognition tasks.

item.title: Online Decision Making with History-Average Dependent Costs (Extended)
item.description: In many online sequential decision-making scenarios, a learner's choices affect not just their current costs but also the future ones.

item.title: Localization Is All You Evaluate: Data Leakage in Online Mapping Datasets and How to Fix It
item.description: The state-of-the-art methods for online mapping are based on supervised learning and are trained predominantly using two datasets: nuScenes and Argoverse 2.

item.title: HyPE-GT: where Graph Transformers meet Hyperbolic Positional Encodings
item.description: Graph Transformers (GTs) facilitate the comprehension of graph-structured data by calculating the self-attention of node pairs without considering node position information.

item.title: EdgeSAM: Prompt-In-the-Loop Distillation for On-Device Deployment of SAM
item.description: It is also the first SAM variant that can run at over 30 FPS on an iPhone 14.

item.title: A Meta-Level Learning Algorithm for Sequential Hyper-Parameter Space Reduction in AutoML
item.description: AutoML platforms have numerous options for the algorithms to try for each step of the analysis, i. e., different possible algorithms for imputation, transformations, feature selection, and modelling.

item.title: CorresNeRF: Image Correspondence Priors for Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: We present CorresNeRF, a novel method that leverages image correspondence priors computed by off-the-shelf methods to supervise NeRF training.

item.title: From Ultra-Fine to Fine: Fine-tuning Ultra-Fine Entity Typing Models to Fine-grained
item.description: We can simply fine-tune the previously trained model with a small number of examples annotated under this schema.

item.title: TaCo: Targeted Concept Removal in Output Embeddings for NLP via Information Theory and Explainability
item.description: In evaluation, we show that the proposed post-hoc approach significantly reduces gender-related associations in NLP models while preserving the overall performance and functionality of the models.

item.title: EasyVolcap: Accelerating Neural Volumetric Video Research
item.description: Volumetric video is a technology that digitally records dynamic events such as artistic performances, sporting events, and remote conversations.

item.title: SSPNet: Scale and Spatial Priors Guided Generalizable and Interpretable Pedestrian Attribute Recognition
item.description: The AFSS module learns to provide reasonable scale prior information for different attribute groups, allowing the model to focus on different levels of feature maps with varying semantic granularity.

item.title: Improving Subgraph-GNNs via Edge-Level Ego-Network Encodings
item.description: We present a novel edge-level ego-network encoding for learning on graphs that can boost Message Passing Graph Neural Networks (MP-GNNs) by providing additional node and edge features or extending message-passing formats.
